Reviews.Title: “Ultimate convinience”
Reviews.Author: Mohamed A
Reviews.Content: Booked this place last minute, one night before arrival to miami as i was on short notice. Fantastic value for price. Large studio with small kitchen and excellent size desk for work. The room is very spacious and can easily sleep 4 ppl. The overall cleanliness is also above average and i would definitely return. Just keep in mind that the hotel advertises its only 15 miles from miami beach/south beach but that is easily 35-40 minutes. not very convenient if the beach is your main destination. Free parking is also available and the breakfast included is only coffee and packaged muffins....

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: grumpy554
Reviews.Content: Just fine for a short stay. Convenient for Miami/Fort Lauderdale

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: BenjaB
Reviews.Content: For a short business stay, this hotel was fine. The workspace area in the room was large with plenty of electrical outlets, but the kitchen area was cramped. Don't expect much for breakfast -- it was free, but only had some cereal, yogurt and wrapped muffins in the small hotel lobby, and unless you are lucky enough to get a spot on the small couch, you eat standing up. The staff was very friendly, however, and helpful with local directions.

Reviews.Title: “Sub-par hotel”
Reviews.Author: theucfan
Reviews.Content: I thought by choosing a Marriott property, I was safe. The hotel was in a decent location, but it needs to be updated. The carpet was worn. I asked for extra towels and did not have them. They only provided one sheet for the pullout sofa bed and they were ripped.

Reviews.Title: “Gross, do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: kristinmomof3
Reviews.Content: I thought by choosing a hotel in the Marriot chain that we would be safe, however I was wrong. The hotel check-in area is nice, but the rest of the hotel is gross. From the minute I stepped into the hallway I knew we were in trouble. Stained carpet, peeling paint, and a horrible smell. Rooms were even worse. The quality of the hotel was that of a Motel 6, if not less. Queen bed smelled of cologne and the mattress felt as though it was 20 years old. Sofa sleeper did not have sheets on it and was disgusting. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “A bit above average”
Reviews.Author: kellbert
Reviews.Content: I needed a decent place for two nights and my budget was $100 per night. TownePlace appeared to be a good option and I was pleased with my stay. It is well located near the highway, about 20 minutes from Miami International Airport. There is a giant map in the lobby so getting to WalMart and nearby restaurants should be easy. My check-in was quick and I was given a suite on the second floor. I found the manual doors to be a headache when travelling with luggage, this is something they should fix. There is an elevator. The room was small for a suite and would be crowded with 4 people. I was travelling alone so it was fine. The TV was old style but lots of channels so it was functional. The kitchen was well equipped and clean. Some fixings for coffee was provided. Noting special about the bath and I noticed there was no safe in the room. Once again, easy to fix. Housekeeping was adequate and the staff were pleasant. When I checked out, I was able to get a yoghurt and orange juice from the helpful front desk person. Although I have rated this property very good, it is really better than average but needs work to be very good. I would stay here again when in the Miami area.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelming smell of mildew”
Reviews.Author: Sarah J
Reviews.Content: I thought I was getting a good deal--$79 a night for a 2 BR suite. It's less of a good deal when I saw the dirty and cracked bathtub and worn living room furniture. However, the halls and room had a very strong odor of mildew. I would not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Little out of the way but ok”
Reviews.Author: theptytraveler
Reviews.Content: Chose this location to be midway between Miami and Sunrise (Sawgrass mall) right off I-75 Living room, kitchenette and bedroom are ok, the bathroom needs renovation as our unit looked worn The breakfast to go was as advertised - it was gone even before the 9:30 deadline Apart from this the price is reasonable for the size of the accomodation

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, not appreciated as a customer”
Reviews.Author: ajmartinezp
Reviews.Content: Bad experience started at the very beginning with the parking situation, it was crowded with little parking space. During the check in process the front desk supervisor denied me a complimentary upgrade with the excuse that the hotel did not offer such benefit to their loyal members, Marriott's website says different. I had to pay additional for the upgrade. The room had a broken coffee maker that spilled the liquid all over the kitchen floor, I cleaned and left the paper towels on the counter to find them on the same spot the very next day "after the housekeeping service cleaned up the room". I asked if I could use the computer (at the lobby) to check in for my flight and their answer was: It doesn't work and will be fixed next week, sorry! No solutions were offered just a justification for their poor customer service. I did not feel appreciated as a customer and won't go back to that hotel or any TownPlace Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for an extended stay hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmiller623
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel. I read most of the reviews prior to staying here. I haven't rated sleep quality because I just checked in today. I will add to this review after I check out. Hallway of main building smells like mildew. The room was okay though. Reminds of you more of an apartment than a hotel. So, it really has everything you could need for extended travel. I can't afford to eat out every day, so, it is nice having a full fridge, range, and oven. Customer service is nice. Housekeeping services are based on the length of your stay, so if you are staying more than 4 days you will only receive services 3 times a week and only full service once a week. This place meets my needs and the room is clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: amoree
Reviews.Content: I stayed the latter half of my vacation here at the TownPlace Suites. We all wished we had come here first because of the convenience of the kitchenette. The staff was very help and friendly. The area is quiet although located in a very busy business district. Close to the expressway. We stayed in the studio suite. Bigger rooms were all booked up. The room was very clean and comfortable. We made it work for all five of us. The only thing I would like to see different would be a bigger pool and a smoke detector that was extra sensitive, (They can turn it off for you at the front desk), and more parking. Other than those minor things, our stay was great!!! I would return again with no hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Menehune089
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and enjoyed the stay. The room was clean and king bed comfortable. The office / lobby was tiny with 1 computer for guest use. Speed in the lobby computer was good. Free wi-fi and speed / connection was good. King bed was comfortable. Location was good being 1 block from Fl 826 Palmetto Expressway. Suite was a 1 bedroom separated from living room / kitchen / bath by a door. Kitchen was tiny but contained stove/ oven , refrigerator, microwave, sink and was complete with paper towels, coffee maker, coffee and condiments, dishes, silverware. Hallways had very dim lighting. Guest services were very friendly and informative. Good value and would recommend to other.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, very dirty, no housekeeper”
Reviews.Author: Tereli
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several Marriott hotels in New York, Orlando, Atlanta and other cities and we were surprised to find out that this Marriot hotel in Miami is very bad. Carpets extremely dirty. They never made the beds. The housekeeper knocked at our door while we were sleeping, gave us some clean towels and stated that she could not come back later to make the beds or clean the room in two days. The kitchen was dirty, needles to say that the dishes and cutlerly were also very dirty. They did not have extra pillows for the sofa. Very dissapointed. We paid the same rate that we paid at Fairfield in Orlando the day before for a very bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the area”
Reviews.Author: platynum1
Reviews.Content: This was my first TownePlace visit. We used this opportunity to get away from the Christmas craziness in the city. The location is convenient to restaurants, food and drug stores, coffee place, and the 826 highway. â€œMain Streetâ€� Miami Lakes for shopping and dining is fairly close, but you will need a car to get there. They have a friendly and helpful staff. The rooms were fine â€“ not as large as other chainâ€™s suites, but comfortable and clean. It is not a new property so it shows some wear and tear. There are several lamps, and the couch lets out if you have one additional adult guest or small children. I prefer a firmer bed, but it may be perfect for others. Having a kitchenette is very convenient when staying for long periods. It has a regular-sized refrigerator/freezer, small stove and oven, microwave, coffee maker (coffee, tea, etc. included), and dishwasher. Also, pots/pans, plates, glasses, etc. for 3-6 people, depending on the number of beds. No problem with the hotel, however, there was lots of noise from other guests, at least when we were there. It reminded me of a college dorm, where you can hear when people close their room doors, talk in the halls â€“ even if theyâ€™re way down the hall. Continental breakfast is available, including: muffins, juice, cereal, coffee/tea, apples and breakfast bars. There was a very small gym, and a coin laundry. The pool is small but it is RIGHT in front where EVERYBODY can see you. Although I might consider a TownePlace in another city, I would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Section 8 Housing?”
Reviews.Author: MysteryMan01
Reviews.Content: Great friendly staff. Rooms fine. Kitchenette convenient when staying for two weeks, which is how long I was there. The problem is....I think this place doubles as "Section 8 Housing". Usually these places have business people that are there for several days/weeks/etc. This property seemed to have about 5% multiple nights guests, and 95% people that just literally walked/crawled off the streets with friends/family/partiers. Three nights in a row, between 2am-4am, several people had a party in the hall. Then they would move the party to the parking lot and hoot & holler some more with car radios. WTF!!!! Location is convenient to restaurants, main roads. No problem with the hotel, main problem with the majority of guests for the entire two week period.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with kitchen and other aminities”
Reviews.Author: Sesime
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Room also had kitchen. Continental breakfast was provided with muffins, cereal bars, orange/apple juice. Not very close to the Miami activities like south beach and happening places, but the price per night was decent.

Reviews.Title: “We had ants...unresponsive staff”
Reviews.Author: rblues07
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Miami Lakes Marriot TownePlace Suites in a 2 bedroom suite. We were advised before we went that the hotel was undergoing a soft renovation and that was fine. I was hoping that we got one of the rooms that had just been painted and got new carpet. Alas, we did not not. Our room was what I would expect for the money we paid. I never really felt like the room was cleaned as well as it should have been and we quickly discovered ants all over the suite, especially in the kitchen. Even though we had a kitchenette, I never felt comfortable leaving food in the fridge or cooking because of the ant situation. They were really small ants that you couldn't barely notice unless you looked very closely, but they were there. 1 hour after getting there, our traveling companions realize that their TV in their room had a green picture and they couldn't adjust it. The old Zenith TV just wasn't cutting it. She called to the front desk to ask for a replacement. 5 days later at checkout, we had never received a replacement TV. I also called and asked about the laundry facility and asked if there was a cost and was told no on the phone, but when I get down to the office, I realize that it was a coin laundry and they charged for the washer/dryers and the soap. I'm fine with paying, but just let me know if it costs money so I don't have to trek all the way back to my room for quarters. Also, it was sporadic when the breakfast would be out. They said it was available from 6-9, but often I went down to the office area at 8am and it wasn't out. Instead, they would ask you what you wanted and then go retrieve it. It seemed to be a total inconvenience and lazy on the staff's part. There were other snafu's, but I do have to say that the beds were comfortable, we received fresh towels everyday and the housecleaning did an okay job of wiping things down. I never felt like things were really cleaned while we were there and not once was the floor vacuumed during our stay. So, if you go to the beach, be careful not to bring sand into your room as it will just stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: CDY
Reviews.Content: Not my favorite of the Marriott brands but for the price it was a pretty good value, Easy to get to, off the Palmetto Expressway, freindly staff. Not much of a breakfast just juice and breakfast bars. Room was clean and decent sized, not a new property so it shows some wear and tear. Priced about $50 less than any other Marriott property at the time I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel in a scarey neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: HoneyBunny271
Reviews.Content: Old, fairly clean hotel in a busy area. Scariest thing is that there are many long term guests there who hang out in the parking lot all night and a trip to your car results in catcalls and hoots from those people. TV did not get sound on many channels. Another in our group had ants everywhere. Desk notified but nothing was ever done. Rooms are so small that I had to watch Tv thru my toes; TV was actually that close to the bed! Continental breakfast was a joke. Donuts/ danish tossed on one table with one self service coffee container sitting next to them. That was it. Nothing else. Staff slept-walked thru their duties and exhibited no personality or guest service skills. Never saw a manager. Maybe they need one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Ok accommodations”
Reviews.Author: ARTaylor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite convenient. Close to the Dolphin & Palmetto freeway... quick route to the beach. We wanted have access to the tourist buzz of Miami with a sense of normal-living. The hotel is in a business area [Miami Lakes Business park is across the street] with lots of conveniences around. WinnDixie, Bank of America, Outback Steakhouse, Subway sandwhich shop. It's pretty easy to get what you need. It's also down the street from Don Shula's Golf Club... lots to do over there. The room is good ...not great, but good. The room could use some updating, but nothing gross, thank goodness. Plain or unattractive furniture doesn't bother me & the furniure is just plain. It's in pretty good condition. I'm more concerned with the bathroom & bed--my family thinks I'm borderline OCD. The bathroom was clean...white tile, no stains on the sink, tub or toilet. The shower head was buildup free--that's a biggie for me. The bed has a good mattress & crisp white linen. The kitchen is well maintained. Plates, glasses & utensels pretty spotless. I noticed there may be an ant problem. I saw teeny tiny ants after leaving a box of cereal & half-eaten candy bar on the counter. Didn't see them anymore after putting ALL food in the fridge. The wireless internet is great....fast & easy connect. The pool was a bit of a disappointment. It's practically in the parking lot & VERY small. It would be great for kids who just want to get wet. There's plenty of parking, but spaces near the pool fill up quick. Wallking from the lot behind the hotel office is fine/safe, but not very convenient if you're in the far building & carrying groceries, beach stuff, etc. Overall good experience. I'll stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable”
Reviews.Author: rbw141rbw141
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Orange Bowl. The location of this hotel is great, only about 10 minutes from the Dolphin stadium. We were in our room less than 20 minutes from the time the game ended. Many of our friends stayed in Miami itself and had a 45 minute drive without traffic. I can't imagine when they got to their rooms. The hotel is fine. Not new but fine. I'd never stayed at this brand before. It seems to be more for long stays (months) but the people were very nice and the hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Free wireless with a USB EZ Air Wireless laptop connection device”
Reviews.Author: Cantchoosescreenname
Reviews.Content: This is a great location. One block from a high speed road. Warning: the traffic is horrible so prepare to stop without warning anywhere, as drivers don't signal or follow rules of the road, driving like maniacs without any sense of safety. Driving times to airport and beach can be very long during traffice accidents, and lengthy rush hours, any time of the day or evening. Shopping area across the street includes fast food and sit down restaurants. One block up the street a Winn Dixie grocery store, Subway fastfood, and other stores.In the back side of the mall across the street is a Cuban restaurant that also offers carryout (Las Delicias Cafe 15462 NW 77 Ct Miami Lake FL 33016) When we visited in November 2006, there were lounge chairs and seating chairs in small but fenced in swimming pool area next to rental office. Staff is bilingual English and Spanish. Free EZAir USB Wireless Laptop Connection device provided by rental office. This even worked on my Windows 98 laptop, which didn't have a wireless card of its own, so that was a great feature. Three color televisions with remote controls, one in each bedroom we stayed in, and one in the living room. Although these are more expensive than smaller rooms in the area motels, they made my family very happy while staying here. Corner two bedroom suite we stayed in had full kitchen with appliances, pots and pans and silverware, safety sprinklers in ceiling, and electric circuit breaker enabled safety outlets. Large number of lamps, overhead lighting, and dining table and coffee table in living room.Free parking with legal warning sign that management not responsible for damage or theft. Free local phone calls.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip for approximately one month. This is a great place for long term travel as well as short term. The employees are very helpful and are very pleasant. It is a little hard to get out of the parking lot on to the main road(Miami Lake Drive), since you have to make a u-turn. The parking is not very good since the hotel had to make use of space for rooms. The room service is wonderful and very thorough. I would suggest this location to anyone staying in Miami. It is also located in a clean area of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gatocalf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 nights in a studio-room of this hotel. If you're looking for a room where you can feel like home, this is a good place for it. The room is rather a small apartment, clean, quiet, with a good AC and a full equiped kitchen. Hotel has a small gym, laundry room, vending machines and free on-site parking. Breakfast is served in a living room, so many people picked a coffe, cereals and/or muffins, and went back to their rooms. It is easy to go anywhere cause the hotel is near Palmetto Expw., and there are several supermarkets near. Rooms are fully cleaned once a week, but they change your towels once every 2 or 3 days (if you want, you could go to the main office and change yourself your towels every day). The only things not so good are: the pool is small and have no chairs, so we saw seldom people in the pool. There is no public computers with Internet connection, so you have to have your own laptop to stay connected. If you don't mind these small issues, this is a excellent hotel and you will not regret for staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just relocated to this hotel from the Residence Inn in Miami/Airport. What a difference. Check the review I submitted for there if youâ€™re considering this area. Staff could not be any nicer or more accommodating here. I needed to check in at noon, they smiled and said, â€œNo problemâ€�. At check-in they upgraded me to a two bedroom, no charge and they were pleased to offer this. If you stop in the office for information or a request, the whole staff present help out. The room was large, immaculate, well appointed, and modern. The deskâ€™s advice on where to eat took me to a small Italian restaurant, about a mile away,where the staff were out of this world there too. Without asking, they discounted price, gave extra food and repeatedly offered me free wine while I waited. I travel many weeks a year for business and look forward to my next trip to my new Miami home. If you check my other reviews here they arenâ€™t always glowing, I try to tell it like it really is. This hotel is great!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs work”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel overall. I was just amazied with the lack of customer service the hotel had. When I went to check in the clerk was very friendly. The clerks did not call to ask if every thing was o.k, nor was I offered the list of amenities of the hotel. The rooming was o.k, it wasn't paradise or anything.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience with all amemities of home”
Reviews.Author: desy
Reviews.Content: I went on a 5 day trip to Ft. Laurderdale and Miami Lakes. I stayed at the Marriott Towneplace Suites in Laurderdale and Miami. The Towneplace suites is a very modern, clean and quuiet atmosphere. They have all the amenities in the room as you would find at home and also a gas grill for hotel guest, (which we took full advantage of). The staff is friendly and it is about a 10 minute drive to the beach. I also recommend the Water Taxi Tour which is 3 hours long if you take the whole trip. The cost is $5.00 and it ia an all day expirence getting on on off the water taxi as much as you like throughout the day. We boarded at Shooter's which was a nice restaurant with a nice outside deck to enjoy the breeze from the water while having your meal. Aslo there is a 1 day cruise by Discovery Cruises but you can stay up to 3 nights to the Bahamas that leaves from Port Everglades which is right by Laurderdale Airport. The cost is $149.00 per person but if it is your birthday you go free and I also recommend the $20 upgrade for the 7 course meal at dinner. I would recommend the Towneplace suites to anyone who likes the quiet life and wants to cook in or out at the property. The kitchen if fully equiped with a stove, fridge, microwave, dishwaher and pots & pans. There is a grocery store close by to obtain those must haves in the room.

HotelInfo.Name: TownePlace Suites Miami Lakes
HotelInfo.Address: 8079 NW 154 Street, Miami, FL 33016
